channel.title: Pseudocode
channel.description: Post pseudocode here. And if you have time, actually make the classes and/or members, and post them here.

item.title: Pseudocode
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:53, topic:160876”][quote author=Cheese_Police link=topic=218912.msg1916676#msg1916676 date=1196966860]

if (Thread.replies.quotes > 1) Thread.warn(Thread.replies.getOwners());
if (Thread.containsPseudocode() && Thread.pseudocodeReplies.getOwners().contains(Users.indexOf("Taharok"))) {
Thread.getReply(Users.indexOf("Taharok")).delete();
Database.sendQuery("DELETE FROM `smf_users` Taharok WHERE `smf_users`.`id`="+Users.indexOf("Taharok"));
Database.update();
}

Oh wow, Taharok still can’t program decently in java, and now he can’t in SQL either!
[/quote]

Oh wow, Cheese Police is still an arrogant prick and apparently does not know how to read Java code, especially java pseudocode!

pardon my flaming[/quote]Your SQL is incorrect though

[quote="_cake, post:52, topic:160876"]sigh…

for(User u : ((Community) CommunityCache.inst().getCachedNodes().find("MoparIsTheBest")).getRegisteredUsers(new PostCountFilter(1))) { if(u.getPosts().findFirstPost(MoparIsTheBest.getCurrentInstance().getSubCommunity("MoparScape")) != null) u.getReputations().getInstance(Reputation.ON_MOPARSCAPE).increment(50); }
imo is better than budda’s[/quote]Throws NoCommunityFoundException.

CASING MY BOY, CASING.

Read full topic

}
}[/code]

item.title: Pseudocode
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“ephemeral, post:43, topic:160876”]Pwnd:

No, see, he was assuming the rest of the code was there.

You don’t need anymore code to avoid making a ‘fail’, as the ‘fail’ was already in the immediate code he posted. You cannot call a method from an array. You need to call this method directly from an Object or a class inside of this array, which in this case would be ‘aUser’.[/quote]Ah, yes. Rictoo does stupid shit like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Pseudocode
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Pwnd:

No, see, he was assuming the rest of the code was there.

You don’t need anymore code to avoid making a ‘fail’, as the ‘fail’ was already in the immediate code he posted. You cannot call a method from an array. You need to call this method directly from an Object or a class inside of this array, which in this case would be ‘aUser’.

Read full topic
